Text.Value: I. Travelled. A. Long. Way.

EditorData.NodeContext: Articulating very clearly - he's trying to make someone who can't speak with animals understand what he's saying.

Text.Value: Just a moment - this man is recording my story.
*He listens, rapt, hanging on every word.*
You're curious - you've got a great many odours about you. What happened to you?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Bear sits back to listen to you.

Text.Value: *Huff!*
That's frightening. I'm glad you made it here. Things are strange right now, but it's no - what did you call it? - Blood War.
Leave.
You ate... a big orb? Curious. It's best not to overindulge, no matter how delectable the morsel.
The city sounds like rot. You're better off right here.
You've got spirit, doing all that for a goddess. I hope she returns your efforts in kind.
I didn't mean to pry.
Selûne's Tears... it must be beautiful to live there.
You'll learn, boy. Give it some time.
*The bear is preoccupied with a shiny pebble. Your presence goes unnoticed.*
Come on... all the druids can understand me, you can - why can't the man with the pen?

EditorData.AnimationTags: Bear gently raising it's left paw and pointing into the distance

Text.Value: *As you near the end of your tale, you see his attention drift as he licks his lips, thinking about something else entirely.*
That's a complicated story. I doubt you'd understand.
I. Am. Far. From. Home.

EditorData.NodeContext: Articulating very clearly - he's trying to make someone who can't speak with animals understand what he's saying.

Text.Value: That sounds... cold. I'm glad you're here now, in the sun.
*His brow furrows. Incomprehensible squiggles surround a crude sketch: a bear disembowelling a clutch of tieflings.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Bear sits down in a huff after seeing whats on Volos page

Text.Value: *As the colourful man starts scribbling, the bear sneaks a quick look at the page.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Volo excited, wighting on a page. The bear leans over to see whats on Volos page
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Volo is excited, writing on the page. The bear leans in to see what he's writing.

Text.Value: *The man nods thoughtfully and adds another dismembered limb to his sketch.*
Tell him your tale - wealth, power, vampires, crypt...
Speak of discipline, secrecy, reverence - fighting for the glory of your blessed goddess.
Tell him about the horrors of the Blood War and your escape from Avernus.
Describe the cold beauty of Crèche K'liir, orbiting high above Toril.
Tell him how you got involved with an angry Netherese orb.
Speak of Baldur's Gate - and tell him how your father cast you out.
Tell him about the intrigues of the Underdark and how you ended up here.
Tell him about the treasures and wars of the Underdark and how you ended up here.
Tell him about the gems and rocks of the Underdark and how you ended up here.
Tell him about your crèche and the monsters that snatched you away.
Tell him about your journey.

Synopsis: Bear in the druid grove. This is a Speak with Animals dialogue. If Volo is there, we sense his frustration at trying to communicate with Volo (who has been asking him questions in an AD). If Volo isn't there, he wants to know who we are. He gets scared of us when we tell him about the tadpole.
